title: Glen Canyon National Recreation Area: Park Home
body: Lake Powell and so much more!  Encompassing over 1.25 million acres, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area offers unparalleled opportunities for water-based & backcountry recreation. The recreation area stretches for hundreds of miles from Lees Ferry in Arizona to the Orange Cliffs of southern Utah, encompassing scenic vistas, geologic wonders, and a vast panorama of human history. Read More             I Should Know These Things   Click here for the latest news about Glen Canyon, road conditions, regulations, updates, and more.            Webcams   Check one of our five webcams to see launching conditions or scenic views of the area.        Park Ranger Programs   From guided hikes to Amphitheater talks to Jr Ranger adventures, check here for Park Ranger programs.              Visitor Centers   Four different visitor centers serve the vast Glen Canyon area. Find the one closest to you.        Lifejackets Are Beautiful And Awesome   Want to save a life? Wear a lifejacket! Click here for more safety tips at Glen Canyon.        Lees Ferry   Glen Canyon is more than Lake Powell! Take a day trip to Lees Ferry for a taste of pioneer life and a chance to see rafting trips embark.              Quagga Mussel Update   Stay current on Glen Canyon's efforts to stop the spread of quagga mussels and other invasive species.        Rainbow Bridge   Did you know Glen Canyon administers Rainbow Bridge National Monument? Click here for more information on this unique natural feature.
